"So, what's got you so happy?" you wonder out loud.

"Oh... don't worry about it." she says, placing a spoon between her grin.

You eat your cereal in silence for a little while longer, but she doesn't stop smiling. Eventually, you can't take it. "Alright. Really." you say, the annoyance very easy to read, "what're you so giddy 'bout?"

"I don't see the-" you begin to say, but she cuts you off, pulling your arm up harder.

"Just do it." she laughs.

You moan and stand up, looking at her face... then at her bare feet, then her face again. She was right, you did understand.

"Are you... You're... taller? How-" you start, but she cuts you off again.

"I know! Isn't it great!" She grins.

Your sister had always been short. All throughout childhood- even by the time she was 16 she only reached a tiny 4'8". She always hated needing help reaching things off tall shelves, and wanted to be taller, but she hadn't grown since... at least until now.

It was obvious she had grown, but you weren't really aware by how much. You decide to ask. "When did this happen?... How much taller-" she once more speaks before you finish. You'd be annoyed if she didn't do it so frequently.

In your own room, you got out your computer and tried to find any information you could about missing children or orphans that might give you a lead on who the girls were and where they came from. Even after what must have been hours of searching through hundreds of articles, you couldn't find anything useful to you. Eventually, sleep overcame you, and you fell asleep at the keyboard.

You went to check on the girls, and the three of them were still sound asleep where you left them. You decided to leave them be and went to your kitchen to make some breakfast.

Reading the letter, the orphanage's director was thanking you for agreeing to adopt the girls, and continued on about how much of a difference you were making in their lives.

Your eyes glossed over the rest of the letter as you tried to process what you read. Sadly, your dad was called into work at the last minute and couldn't be there for your birthday. He enjoyed his work most of the time, but he was not happy about having to work on the day he specifically booked off so he could enjoy being with his family on his daughter's special day. But apparently they were desperate, so he had agreed to go. At any rate, you knew exactly what to wish for.

You coughed a couple times, and while internally you were screaming things along the lines of, 'I'm going to kill you, you twit!!!', you quickly forced such destructive thoughts out of your mind and instead said half-sarcastically, "Nice. Nathan looked understandably less than enthused. Birthday candle wax wasn't exactly the tastiest thing in the world. But he still justified it as totally worth it.

He was robed entirely in grey with a matching long, pointed hat, and carried a long, wooden staff. Wait. You knew this man, or wizard as it were!

"You...you're Gandalf! But...you're not real! How can you be here?" To which the old wizard smiled as he puffed his pipe as he replied, "Ah! Yes! And yet I stand before you as we speak. This concerns and elates you at the same time. Your dream is coming true! ...but people don't usually suddenly grow noticeably taller with their clothes keeping up, do they?
